stack.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to make things into a neat pile, or to form a neat pile
stack.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The assistants price the items and stack them on the shelves.
stack.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put neat piles of things on something
stack.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He went back to stacking the shelves.
The floor was stacked with boxes.
stack.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a temporary store of information on a computer
stack.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to put things into neat piles
stack.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The supermarkets failed to stack the shelves during opening hours.
stack.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: to put a group of people, or vehicles or other things in a particular order as they wait to do something
stack.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: The two airliners were stacking as they waited to land.
